alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 1:52PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bay County through 215 PM EDT/115 PM CDT/... At 152 PM EDT/1252 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong shower near Hiland Park, or 7 miles northeast of Callaway, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lynn Haven, Bayhead, Bennett, Southport, Cairo, Brannonville, Recota Beach, College Station, Vicksburg, Bayou George, Majette and Camp Flowers. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
